title: “Before you diagnose yourself with depression or low self-esteem, first make sure that you are not, in fact, just surrounded by assholes.” Who said this, Freud or Gibson? - Quora

response.answer_text: [1] Neither of them said it. Gibson literally just retweeted it. The tone of the sentence is not something any scientist would say. Let alone ones born before the 1950’s. So upon research, I found this hilarious story: Again, Gibson confirmed it was a tweet he liked, and simply retweeted. He attempted to give credit to the twitter handle @5tevenW, where Gibson saw the quote and had first retweeted it. This Twitter user, Steven Winterburn, did indeed try to claim the credit. However, Mr. Winterburn first used the quote on May 24, 2011, 16 months after Debbie Hope. Debbie Hope, owner of the Twitter handle @debihope, tweeted it on Jan 24, 2010. That’s where the story ends. They did a deep dive into Freud’s writing, and concluded he isn’t the author. There is no backing evidence. Comment below if you have any further information on the whereabouts of Debbie Hope, and or statements regarding this. Footnotes[1] PhilosFX

Although people suspected that the mentioned saying’s author was Sigmund Freud (an Austrian neurologist and the founder of psychoanalysis), or William Gibson (an American-Canadian fiction writer and essayist), or is unknown, quote investigator found the earliest post of the saying as a tweet made by @debihope in 2010. Quote investigator connected with her, and she said that the saying popped out of her head and was based on a past boyfriend.
